entry.title: CV
entry.summary: Scihouse Inc. Indiana, USA R&D Researcher in Nacre bioreactors March ’21 - present Devolving nacre like material with the aim to produce a range of economically viable products that fill the niche of carbon composites at a reduced ecological impact. Lead researcher for Luna utilization…
entry.content:
Scihouse Inc. Indiana, USA

R&D Researcher in Nacre bioreactors March ’21 - present

Devolving nacre like material with the aim to produce a range of economically viable products that fill the niche of carbon composites at a reduced ecological impact.

R&D Lead Launchpad Dust Mitigation with Chitosan Biofoam and In Situ Resource March 2021 - March 2022

Lead researcher for Luna utilization of in situ resources with a aim to create solutions to luna habitation ,with pre-existing technologies that haven’t seen use in aerospace to. decrease time needed for a minimal viable product.

Project lead HeroX Watts on the Moon Challenge, NASA Centennial Challenges Program Jan 2021 - March 2022

Successfully Completed phase 1 as Project lead for “Gabriel Licina’s team” at the NASA Centennial Challenges Program.

successfully filed a funding request to NASA for a proposed a solution to the watts on the moon challenge hosted by HeroX our solution is meant to be simple and elegant with little waist and few moving parts.

R&D Project lead Reduced cost Daytime Radiative cooling June 2020 - present

present Research a means of reducing the cost of the radiative cooling potential of low-cost metamaterial coatings as a means of utilising low quantity geothermal energy to provide power in unmaintained situations, as a competitor to current terrestrial Radioisotope thermoelectric generator technology but without the need for dangerous radiation sources.

3D Crowd, Manchester ,United Kingdom

Emergency PPE courier April - May 2020

During the pandemic, I helped the PPE shortage in the UK by providing a daily courier service shipping 3d printed PPE face shield parts from local makers by bicycle to the central hub in Manchester. Where they got assembled then sterilised. Before sent off to the front line at no cost. totalling 200,000 face shields 3D Printed and distributed.

Steam museum, Bolton ,United Kingdom

Museum Conservationist 2018 - 2020

My role is to service the museum exhibits, carry out routine maintenance. carry out part fabrication through a number of processes such as and not limited too, shaping, turning, grinding, milling for the many working steam engines that range in age from early Victorian to late 20th century on the show with notable engines belonging to the late Fred Dibnah.

Network Engineer 2018 - 2020

My role is to service the computer systems the museum uses to store its archive. the fixing of interactive exhibits and service of the closed-circuit security system. providing their cybersecurity needs for GDPR compliance.

Publications

A. Bennett and G. Licina, “Launchpad Dust Mitigation with Chitosan Biofoam and In Situ Resource.pdf,” Lunar Surface Innovation Consortium, Apr. 2021, p. 2, [Online].

Community Projects

Hackspace Manchester

I’ve run a local Hackspace for the past 5 years,

PCBEE sciencemuseum annual review:24-25

A community outreach scheme too educate STEM subjects by hosting a number of workshops at the events such as Makefest Manchester and Maker Faire Newcastle.

For this we desgined our own PCB badge, Used to teach the public basic soldring skils can build a LED badge in the shape of the Manchester’s worker bee.

Historia Normannis

Armourer stunt operator 2015 – present

For 6 years I’ve helped run a national historical re-enactment society as their armourer. responsibilities involve inspection of props and maintaining a high level of safety in battlefield equipment. fabrication and operation of stunt rigs for use in public events such as “Siege of Kenilworth” a high level of training passing an SAP (Stunt and pyrotechnics training) test it’s needed to operate a stunt rig correctly with the prime objective of spectator/actor safety within the stressful environments of a battlefield.

Human resources 2015 - 2016

A democratically elected role whose first point of call for intergroup conflicts acting as an independent entity to provide neutral advice and support. providing the services of safeguarding members wellbeing. This is important as the battlefield is inherently a dangerous place to be and keeping it a safe place a level of trust needs to be maintained in all percipients to maintain the strict standards of safety through training and discipline that’s expected of us at events by our client’s.

Education

Bolton University Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

BSc Computer Networks and Security 2:1

  • Enterprise Lan networks With a focus on Cisco Lab work
    • all hail the Cisco Router cli
  • Enterprise WAN and work from home VPN’s
  • Switching networks architecture , Spanning tree , SNMP , Domains and VLAN’s
  • Cyber Security
  • Physical Security and Social Engineering Defence
  • Web design with a focus on backend software such as Node.js and PHP
  • System administrator of Linux Systems

Focussed on the design and implementation of enterprise computer networks such as the deployment of SNA mainframes in the banking sector as well as cybersecurity and penetration testing with Kali linux.

Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP) Late 2019

on hiatus due to the pandemic forced closed of certification examination

Completed course material

  • Penetration Testing: What You Should Know
  • Getting Comfortable with Kali Linux
  • Command Line Fun
  • Practical Tools
  • Bash Scripting
  • Passive Information Gathering
  • Active Information Gathering
  • Vulnerability Scanning
  • Introduction to Buffer Overflows
  • Client-Side Attacks
  • File Transfers
  • Antivirus Evasion
  • Password Attacks
  • Port Redirection and Tunneling
  • The Metasploit Framework

Kali Linux Certified Professional (KLCP) Late 2019

on hiatus due to the pandemic forced closed of certification examination

Completed course material

  • About Kali Linux
  • Getting Started with Kali Linux
  • Linux Fundamentals
  • Installing Kali Linux
  • Configuring Kali Linux
  • Helping Yourself and Getting Help
  • Securing and Monitoring Kali Linux
  • Debian Package Management
  • Advanced Usage
  • Kali Linux in the Enterprise
  • Introduction to Security Assessments

Professional Qualifications

  • Cisco CCNA 2013

Skills

Practical specialties: turret Milling, manual lathe, traditional carpentry and cabinet making, wood turning, 3d printing, CNC milling, vacume forming, costume design. prop design Technical specialties: Network design and implementation, with(in) a team. I love Python and play with regularly with Bash. Solid knowledge of Sytems administration , IoT Systems technologies: HTML+CSS, NodeRed,webhooks,Kali linux,OPSECLinux administration skills: bash, Apache, MySQL, virtualization VMware.

Interests

playing the ocarina and have been for over 10 years, cycling and home cooking

entry.title: Project: In to the Ai-verse
entry.summary: as part of AutoCrat project i will need a way of generating text from a prompt and will all the hype of ChatGPT you think that would be a great contender for this and you be right, untill you remember EMF happens in a field…
entry.content:
as part of AutoCrat project i will need a way of generating text from a prompt and will all the hype of ChatGPT you think that would be a great contender for this and you be right, untill you remember EMF happens in a field in the middle of nowhere and internet will be slow enough that handling all the compute in the cloud is not an option so enter player 2, a dell 1U server with 128gb of ram. 

Adventure 

one long car journey and a lot of sweat and swearing as push a 1U server and monitor into the back of a hatchback in the middle of northwest

getting it setup on the desk before it goes in a rack, dahm these are loud, extra points for RGB. OS of choice for servers is Ubuntu server edition as its install is painless and has all the drivers for raid controllers and is possible to add open SHH from the install and no need to do it later.

All setup

OS installed and SHH working can sit back and enjoy getting an LLM installed.

entry.title: Sub 40 Min Benchy with ender 3v2 for under £20
entry.summary: the old ender 3v2 needed replacement parts mainly its extruder was broken and the hotend was getting clogged every other print. so maybe it was a time for upgrade and without breaking the bank the cheap all metal geared extruders for the ender 3 are…
entry.content:
the old ender 3v2 needed replacement parts mainly its extruder was broken and the hotend was getting clogged every other print. so maybe it was a time for upgrade and without breaking the bank 

Hardware needed 

  1. a geared extruder 
  2. bi metal hotend

the cheap all metal geared extruders for the ender 3 are cheap and allow for the filament to be pushed harder and retreated faster, price £8 free shipping, the Bi metal hotend is magic the bottom made of titanium of the hotend remains hot allowing for high flow rates but the top made of copper tranmits the heat away from the filament preventing heat creep. 

software 

the ender 3 bowden tube is known for causing issues with clogging and resistant too pressure change that retraction and changes in speed of extruding cause. so we want to keep the pressure in the tube as constant as possible. we do this with automatic speed on prusia slicer you have measure the max flow rate of the hotend mine maxed out at 8mm^2/s with PLA, then slicer takes care of the rest.

the steppers on the ender 3v2 have a lot more torque than you'll expect so its simple to go into the firmware and up the acceleration until it didn't skip.

Results in action

entry.title: Project: Pen plotter time ✒️
entry.summary: For AutoCrat to put ink to paper it needs a way of automatic writng and for this we use the humble pen plotter. while at first glance is a complex machine with all the belts and pulleys's A pen plotter moves its x-y platform by…
entry.content:
For AutoCrat to put ink to paper it needs a way of automatic writng and for this we use the humble pen plotter. while at first glance is a complex machine with all the belts and pulleys's

how a pen plotter works

A pen plotter moves its x-y platform by using a combination of stepper motors and belts, just like a 3D printer. However, instead of extruding plastic, a pen plotter holds a pen or other writing instrument that is moved across the surface of a piece of paper or other material. The platform is typically mounted on a set of linear bearings, which allow it to move smoothly and accurately in the x-y plane. As the motors turn, the belts pull the platform in the desired direction, allowing the plotter to create precise drawings and designs. By carefully controlling the motion of the platform and the pen, pen plotters can produce highly detailed and accurate artwork.

How to talk pen plotter

G-code is a programming language used to control the movements of pen plotters and other CNC machines. It consists of a series of commands that tell the plotter how to move the x-y platform and pen, when to turn the pen on and off, and at what speed to move.

In a pen plotter context, G-code is generated by a drawing program that creates a design or image, which is then converted into a series of G-code commands. These commands tell the plotter how to move the x-y platform and pen to recreate the design on a piece of paper or other material.

For example, a G-code command might look something like this: G1 X10 Y20 E0.3 F300. This command would tell the plotter to move the x-y platform to position X=10, Y=20 (measured in millimeters), while simultaneously lowering the pen to the paper and drawing a line with a thickness of 0.3mm at a speed of 300mm/min.

Build time

while borrowing a pen plotter that runs on the opensource GURBL firmware and using the gcode generator in Inkscape i did a couple test letters by using the hershies text function thats after a lot of messing around writing rude words and lines. 

the toolchain for inkscape can not be automated but as a proff of concept it did produce nice results after much screaming at the sky i made one last item a map that now sits nicely one our wall

entry.title: Project: AutoCrat
entry.summary: AutoCrat is a project that aims to create a robot capable of reading, writing, and folding hand-written letters, as well as performing other "paperwork" tasks. The project is intended to be a cutting-edge robot that can revolutionize the way we handle our paperwork. Before we…
entry.content:
AutoCrat is a project that aims to create a robot capable of reading, writing, and folding hand-written letters, as well as performing other "paperwork" tasks. The project is intended to be a cutting-edge robot that can revolutionize the way we handle our paperwork.

Before we dive into the nitty-gritty details of building AutoCrat, let's take a moment to understand what this project is all about. AutoCrat is essentially a robot that can perform tasks that are typically done by humans, such as reading and writing letters, filling out forms, and processing data. The idea behind AutoCrat is to automate mundane tasks so that humans can focus on more important things, like creativity and problem-solving.

Step 1: where do we start

oh boi this is going to be big so lets split this up into its individual parts these will change as /cross fingers

  1. something to write with eg. pen plotter
  2. tool chain too convert text -> SVG -> Gcode
  3. Ai too generate the text using an LLM 
  4. A way to generate believable handwriting 
  5. Folding paper

Step 2: why

no one likes paperwork and the people that do i dont understand so why not have a robot do it for you, what could go wrong.

Step 3: where

first copy of the AutoCrat will be unveiled at the EMF Camp in 2024
